answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some resources you may find useful.
This report discusses, “Health Insurance for Active and Retired City Employees.”Page 5 includes a description of the High Deductible Health Plan used in Denver. 
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/303476
I also found a couple of places with High Deductible Health Plans in place. You may want to contact them directly with more information about their programs. 
The City of Farmers Branch, TX has a High Deductible Health Plan with a Health Savings Account (HSA).
http://www.ci.farmers-branch.tx.us/work/human-resources/benefits
Marble-Falls, TX also has a HSA Qualified Plan.
http://www.ci.marble-falls.tx.us/emp_benefits.pdf
Topeka, KS offers a high deductible plan as an option.
http://www.topeka.org/pdfs/BENEFIT_SUMMARY.pdf
The City of Hays, KS has had success with a High Deductible Health Plan. You can read more about their consideration of the program in this memo from the Office of the City Manager. 
http://www.haysusa.com/FINAL_-_11-03-11_WORK_SESSION_AGENDA_PACKET.pdf
I also found a New York Times article discussing the pros and cons of High Deductible Health Plans.
http://www.nytimes.com/2010/08/28/health/28patient.html
This is a recent report from the US Bureau of Labor Statistics about the rise of such health plans in the country.
http://www.bls.gov/opub/perspectives/program_perspectives_vol3_issue4.pdf
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern 
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Gregory Stopka
text: Does anyone offer a “high deductible health plan (HDHP)?  If yes, which account based health plans are offered:  Health Reimbursement Accounts (HRA-city contribution only), or Health Savings Accounts (HSA-city and employee contribution), or other?
title: HDHP Plans?
